answers.author: Derek Johnson
answers.text:
Hi Jessica, 
I think it's going to be difficult to find examples that dovetail completely with your own city's policies and procedures. I can recommend ICMA's orientation page ( http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/kn/Topic/186/Orientation#Tab=Overview ) which may have some helpful documentation. You can also try contacting the topic leaders on the right hand side to see if they can help you further. Their email addresses are listed in their profiles. 
Beyond that, I can only provide some links to orientation manuals for other cities and states that I found through a Google search. There may be specific passages in each one that may help you in your search.
City of St. Cloud, Minnesota: http://bit.ly/g2h3J3
State of Vermont: http://bit.ly/gCof1Q
Municipalities in Missouri (this one has sections that deal with parliamentary procedures, agenda items and other process-oriented questions): http://bit.ly/f9omDQ
Hope this helps. Good luck!

author: Jessica Roth
text:
Our City is interested in creating an orientation packet for newly elected officials.  We are aware that most, if not all, of the state municipal associations produce such a document.  However, we want to put one together that is specific to our City - what types of purchases do we reimburse, how do elected officials get items on the agenda, what level of staffing can they expect, etc.?  If anyone has any examples that they could share so we can get ideas for the various issues that should be included, I'd appreciate it!
Jessica Roth
Asst. to City Manager
City of Suwanee, GA
jroth@suwanee.com
title: Elected Officials Orientation Packet
